title.rendered: Discord wants to get into the world of cryptocurrencies and NFTs, users disagree

content.rendered:
Discord’s CEO recently said that the platform could support cryptocurrencies and NFTs. This has led many users to disagree that their Nitro subscriptions (a paid Discord service) could be used to fund the fraudulent NFT ecosystem in the future. The tweet sparked massive anger among Discord users, and many have unsubscribed from the platform’s premium service or threatened to do so.

probably nothing pic.twitter.com/p4P6MoNGgd

— Jason Citron (@jasoncitron) November 8, 2021

Responding to a tweet about Discord and NFT, Discord CEO Jason Citron shared a screenshot of what appears to be a Discord beta feature that offers built-in access to cryptocurrency wallets, MetaMask, and WalletConnect that allow users to access Ethereum, one of the biggest cryptos right now.

Why a large part of users do not agree with this?

Will the Discord thing ever come true? Let’s remember that a single Ethereum transaction uses as much electricity as a home does in a working week. The Ethereum foundation made some official statements promising that the network will move to a less environmentally aggressive model. But crypto pundits have been saying this is coming any day now for years, so we’ll believe it when we see it.

Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) are a kind of digital art receipts that are glued to a ‘block chain’, which is the same technology that powers cryptocurrencies. NFT has the same environmental problem other than that it is riddled with all sorts of scams.

Three months ago, Discord ran a survey asking users about NFTs and since the CEO’s tweet surfaced, many subscribers have been frustrated by the lack of a system to convey their negative feelings about NFTs to the company.
